channel.title: Home on Owen Churches's blog
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Owen Churches's blog

item.title: South Australian Legislative Network
item.description: Background I joined the public service in 2017. Pretty soon after I started my boss and new colleagues suggested that the most important thing for me to read would be the legislation that I work under1. The thing is, when reading my legislation, I realised that it referenced several other pieces of legislation. This meant that to fully understand my legislation I also had to read these referenced pieces of legislation.

item.title: About me
item.description: TL;DR Public sector statistician Former neuroscienctist Long version The past I completed my PhD at the Univeristy of Cambridge in 2011 and until 2017, I was a neuroscientist. There is a good list of my academic publications here. I quite enjoyed a lot about being an academic. I did some lectures where I lead the class in protest against the tyrany of frequentist statistics1: And I was sometimes joined for lectures by a virtual teaching assistant.
